newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: Austrian shares end off, further consolidation seen.
newsitem.headline: Austrian shares end off, further consolidation seen.

text.p: Austrian shares ended weaker on Wednesday amid slim volumes and traders predicted further consolidation at the present level.
The 21 blue chip ATX index tumbled 6.51 points or 0.52 percent to 1,249.92. Among its constituents 15 shares fell, five rose and one remained unchanged.
"There is nothing very stimulating going on in the market. We actually held up pretty well," said one trader.
Dealers did not foresee any major moves ahead of the futures and options expiry next week.
"Next week is the expiry so I would think we could move between 1,240 and 1,255 before then," said one trader.
"We are well-supported at the present level," said another.
Oils and chemicals group OMV led the decliners, dropping 1.77 percent to 1,390 schillings.
The session's leading gainer was brickmaker Wienerberger, climbing 1.32 percent to 2,300 schillings
The March ATX future shed 5.0 points to 1,252.5.
The broad-based Vienna bourse index slipped 1.34 points or 0.29 percentlower to 464.96.
